M.P.SHAMEEM AHAMED AKHTiV PHILIP MANITHOTTIYIL RESPONDENTS /RESPONDENT NO.1/INVESTIGATION OFFICER/DEFACTO COMPLAINANT/2ND WITNESS: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 2 THE ASSISTANT SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE ATHOLI POLICE STATION, ATHOLI (PO), ATHOLI (VIA), PIN - 673315 3 JASEERA AGED 32 YEARS D/O MAJEED, KURUNNAYIL HOUSE, ULLOOR KADAV, KUNNATHARA POST, PIN - 673620 4 SUHARA AGED 53 YEARS W/O MAJEED, OTTOL HOUSE, KATALUR POST, MOODADI, KOZHIKODE RURAL, PIN - 673529 SR.PP-SRI.RENJIT GEORGE THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 22.01.2024, THR COURT ON THE SAMBR DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: 2024/KER/5245 CRL.MC NO.20 OF 2024 2 ORDER Dated this the 22" day of January , 2024 This Crl.M.C., under Section 482 of Cr.P.C., is filed by the sole accused in Crime No.189 of 2022 of Atholy Police Station, Kozhikode, registered under Sections 448, 341, 323, 506 and 294(b) of IPC, for quashing all proceedings in C.C.No.465 of 2022 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Perambra. 2. The prosecution allegation is that on 06.06.2022, the accused, in a fit of rage, against the 3rd respondent, who was his ex-wife, trespassed into the house of respondents 3 and 4, and physically assaulted and verbally abused them. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioner submitted that the matter stands settled between himself and respondents 3 and 4. The defacto complainant and 4th respondent entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that 2024/KER/5245 CRL.MC NO.20 OF 2024 the matter stands settled. " Annexures A3 and A4 are affidavits filed by them, endorsing the settlement. They have no intention to proceed with the prosecution, and they have no objection in quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.465 of 2022. 4. On instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter is settled and he produced signed statement of respondents 3 and 4. In that statements also, they have stated that they are not intending to proceed with the prosecution, and they have no objection in quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.465 of 2022. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303) ], and State of Madhya Pradesh vy. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the les Lent EH Neer e 2024/KER/5245 CRL.MC NO.20 OF 2024 4 petitioner can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.MC is allowed, and the proceedings in C.C.No.465 of 2022 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Perambra, stands quashed.
